reviews.review_title: Perfect Detergent for a Fresh, Deep Clean Every Time
reviews.review_text:
Tide Laundry Detergent Liquid in the Original Scent is hands down my favorite laundry detergent. The scent is fresh and classic—just the way I remember it. It’s strong enough to leave my clothes smelling amazing without being overpowering.

This detergent does an excellent job of deep cleaning, even with my toughest loads. It gets out stains, dirt, and odors effectively, which is especially important with my kids' clothes and workout gear. I’ve noticed that my whites are noticeably brighter and my colors stay vibrant, which is a huge plus for me. It really helps with keeping fabrics looking like new.

The 132 fl oz bottle is a great value because it lasts for a long time, giving me 100 loads of clean, fresh laundry. It’s also HE-compatible, so it works perfectly in my high-efficiency washer. Tide has always been a trusted brand for me, and this liquid detergent lives up to that reputation.

Overall, if you're looking for a reliable detergent that cleans well, smells great, and brightens your clothes, I highly recommend this Tide product. It’s the best detergent I’ve used and will definitely keep buying it.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025

reviews.review_title: Reliable Clean with a Fresh Scent
reviews.review_text:
I've been using Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent in the Original Scent for years, and it consistently delivers excellent results. The detergent effectively removes everyday dirt and stains, leaving clothes smelling fresh without being overpowering. It's compatible with high-efficiency washers, making it a convenient choice for modern laundry needs.

The 64-load size is practical for households, and the packaging is user-friendly. While it's a bit pricier than some alternatives, the performance justifies the cost. Overall, if you're looking for a dependable detergent that combines cleaning power with a pleasant scent, this Tide variant is a solid choice.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2025

reviews.review_text: Securely packaged and arrived on time. Brand favorite. Has consistently worked for me. Very sensitive skin. Will break out if you look at me wrong. Tide Sensitive doesn't give me the same sense of "clean" feeling. Tide Original has never let me down. Everything comes out feeling and smelling clean and I never have a negative reaction. Works on the toughest of stains. Run the item under cold water, put Tide Original on it, & let it sit. Before washing, give a good hand scrub then in the proper wash load. Comes out clean every time. Tide Original, all day, all the way....

reviews.review_title: Price of Tide refills has increased almost 33% since 2019 and 12% since October 2020.
reviews.review_text: I started ordering these refills a few years ago. I like being able to refill my detergent bottle with less packaging and with less than some giant container that is difficult to lift or store. I'm always sensitive to the cost per ounce of liquid detergent and I compare the cost vs just buying a new bottle of detergent every time. Today I wanted to buy another refill pack only to find that the price has gone up 33% since late 2019, and 12% just since October 2020. I think I'm going to shop around a bit before I make any more purchases of these refill packs.

reviews.review_title: and people in my life I recommend brands to
reviews.review_text: Hey Tide, I'm so angry with you. You have ruined my clothing. I live in downtown Manhattan. I have a lot of friends, family, and people in my life I recommend brands to. I trusted Tide. Living in New York as a millennial who is still working hard to get up the ladder & grow my career, I have to be careful how I spend - and my clothes are something I pick with care, and take pride in. I trusted you (a brand I've known my whole life, and was always loyal to) to help me take care of my clothes. I repeat: I trusted you. And today, you ruined my clothes. Stained blue - and upon hopping on Google (in tears, calling my mom, while packing for a vacation I'd so been looking forward to) I learned that this product has ruined other people's clothes, too. And you've done nothing about it. Which is truly maddening - you're a trusted, beloved brand! Why would you continue to market a product that you are well aware ruins people's clothing? They trusted you. They saw that Tide logo and thought, "they'll take care of me & the things I choose to buy and wear every day. They'll deliver." And you've hurt a lot of people with a product that, as it turns out, isn't trustworthy. I'm disappointed, above anything. I have a load of stained, sopping wet clothes spread over my tiny apartment kitchen as I frantically try to rinse out an excess detergent, and salvage what I can. I'm heading home for the week - my best friend is getting married - and I decided to go shopping for my trip. I chose Tide this morning at the grocery store to do my laundry. I leave for the airport in two hours, and have a kitchen full of soaking, stained, brand new clothes. You have lost a lifelong customer. And many more, as I'll continue to write about this on any forum I can find until you discontinue this product. It isn't fair - we trusted you.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017

reviews.review_title: Tide Original Scent Liquid Laundry Detergent: Trusted Cleaning Power for Fresh, Clean Clothes
reviews.review_text:
Tide Original Scent Liquid Laundry Detergent has been a staple in my household for years, and it continues to impress with its exceptional cleaning power and refreshing scent.

With 64 loads packed into a 92 fl oz bottle, this detergent offers excellent value for money, making it a cost-effective option for families or individuals with much laundry to tackle. The high-efficiency (HE) formula ensures that it's suitable for use in both standard and high-efficiency washing machines, providing versatility and convenience.

What sets Tide apart is its ability to effectively remove tough stains and odors, leaving clothes looking and smelling fresh and clean after every wash. Whether it's food stains, grass marks, or sweat odors, Tide tackles them all easily, even in cold water cycles.

The Original Scent is a classic favorite, offering a pleasant, long-lasting fragrance that leaves laundry smelling great for days. It's not overpowering but provides just the right amount of freshness.

While Tide may be slightly pricier than other laundry detergents on the market, its superior cleaning performance and reliable results make it worth the investment. Plus, the large bottle size means fewer trips to the store for replenishment.

Overall, Tide Original Scent Liquid Laundry Detergent is a trusted and reliable choice for anyone seeking clean, fresh-smelling clothes with minimal effort. It's a household essential that I highly recommend to others looking for top-quality laundry care.

reviews.review_title: New HE Turbo Clean works great!
reviews.review_text:
I received 2 bottles of liquid Tide HE Turbo Clean to try out for free.

As a mother of 2 small children (ages 7 and 2) plus 2 dogs, I end up doing several loads of laundry per week. We have had an HE washer for only a couple of years and in that time frame, I have used several different brands and types of detergent. One of my biggest complaints with the HE brands of detergent is that there is often a residue left on our clothing after a cycle is finished (which is especially apparent when cleaning black or dark colored clothing). The new Tide HE Turbo Clean claims to eliminate this problem, so I was eager to put it to the test.

I first was asked to do a Quick Cycle using the detergent to demonstrate how the Turbo Clean performed in a faster time. I grabbed the first available items of clothing that were ready for a wash to perform this experiment - my daughter's chlorine-soaked swim suit and cover up. I had a little bit of difficulty measuring the correct amount of detergent, as the cap with measuring lines in it is blue and so is the detergent. I usually add an oxygen booster powder to each load but since I wanted to get a true sense of how this detergent worked, I left out this step for this experiment. Once the Turbo Clean was added to the detergent dispenser, I ran the Quick Cycle. The length of time for the load to be finished coordinated exactly to the time counter on the machine. I have found with using other detergents that it takes longer than stated on the machine since there are often extra suds left over that take additional time to rinse off. The swim suit and cover up came out smelling clean and fresh with no traces of chlorine whatsoever. I was impressed, as with my usual detergent there is definitely still a slight chemical smell.

Next up was running a normal wash cycle. For this, I used my older daughter's clothing. She had just happened to have gotten a large pizza stain on her white shirt, so I was eager to see how the Tide Turbo Clean would work on this type of dirt. Again, I omitted the usual oxygen booster but did use a spray on stain remover. This time, the actual cycle end time ended up being 2 minutes quicker than what was first projected by the machine - a huge improvement. All of her clothes came out smelling clean. However, the pizza stain remained. (Honestly though, I am not sure that any detergent would have removed it without bleach.) The bottoms of her socks were clean and other small dirt stains were gone.

I then did a load of toddler clothes. Although not as dirty as her older sister's clothing, her clothes did contain surface food spots, urine dampness and grass stains. I used less of the detergent since the load of clothes was smaller. Once again, the cycle was perfectly coordinated with the timer on the machine. I think of the loads of laundry done, this one worked the best with the detergent. Everything came out looking fresh and new. She is tough on her socks and with my regular detergent, they still look dingy. With the Tide HE Turbo Clean, they came out bright and clean.

I did not have an opportunity to try the detergent on my own clothing in the timeframe for which I was asked to provide my feedback. However, based on the performance of these other loads, I am optimistic that the issue of long, over-sudded cycles will be eliminated. Apart from the measuring difficulties, the Tide is easy to use. I feel like a little goes a long way and you can't beat the fresh scent Tide can be counted on to provide. I would definitely continue to use the Turbo Clean and would recommend it to other busy laundry-doers!
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2015

reviews.review_text:
I was given this product for free in exchange for my honest review, and honestly..... I loved it!

I have a family of five; my husband, my 10 year old son, my 3 year old son, my 11 month old son, and myself. Boys, boys, boys... and boys=MESS!

I evaluated how this product worked in a few different ways. First, I tried this out on my husband's clothes (I wash his separately because his job and hobbies are quite dirty... furniture manufacturing and car mechanics). For his clothes, I used the regular cycle and was surprised to see that the product did, indeed, do one of the things it claimed to do. Usually, with my other brand of detergent, my washer tells me I have 1 minute left in the cycle for about 10-15 minutes. So, I was surprised to see that it actually finished the cycle ON TIME! That was nice.. His clothes not only smelled nice, but came out quite clean. I didn't tell him that I was trying anything different beforehand, just to see if he would notice, and he DID! He asked me what I did differently, because his clothes actually had that "clean smell" all day at work. He also commented that he didn't notice that "film" on his clothes either. Almost a week later, his clothes still smell nice!

Next, I washed my children's clothes. I wash my 10 year old's clothes separately from my younger two son's clothes. I decided to use the quick wash cycle with my oldest son's clothes, and it definitely got that pre-teen boy smell out! And better, I believe, than my usual brand does. From then, I decided to experiment with a white polo shirt that belongs to my 3 year old. He had spilled chocolate milk all down the front of it, and the stain had set in. I wanted to see the true power of the Tide Turbo Clean, so I bravely washed it without bleach. Did it remove the stain?? Not all the way, but I could barely see it, which surprised me, because that spill happened about 4 days prior to washing it. I washed it again, and added bleach, and poof... the stain was completely gone.

Now, I was hesitant on washing my 11 month old's clothing, seeing as I have always used a dye-free brand of detergent for his clothes (for fear of sensitive skin issues), but I tried it anyways. His clothes, like the other clothes, washed and smelled great, too. And luckily, no skin irritation as of yet (it's only been about 2 days since I washed his clothes with this).

My last experiment (in the time allotted for this review) was to wash a bed pillow that I was going to throw away because of it's filthiness. It had yellowed badly and had a sweaty, stinky odor. I ran it in my washer on a "heavily soiled" cycle, again with no bleach to test the strength of the product (and because I was just going to throw this pillow away anyways, so why not). The yellowing is very, very slight now... and the smell is COMPLETELY gone. I now don't need to throw it away. It smells so clean and fresh!

I do believe that this product has made me think about my future purchases of laundry detergent. The only con I had with the product was the packaging itself. It was hard to see the different lines on the cap for the amount of detergent to use. After studying it for a few moments, and twisting and turning the cap towards the light, I could discern the different levels for each load. But another puzzling thing was that my front load washer has a "maximum" amount of liquid detergent that you can use, and the amount the cap suggested for a large load was quite a bit more than the maximum amount my washer allows. So, I didn't use the full strength, because I didn't want take a chance of messing up my washer's functionality. But obviously from my review, that did not matter because the product exceeded my expectations.

I would definitely recommend the Tide HE Turbo Clean laundry detergent!
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2015

reviews.review_title: Excellent Product, but Deceptive Packaging Claims
reviews.review_text:
Tide is one of the best laundry formulations hands down, but I continue to be frustrated with their smoke & mirrors packaging promises when it comes to load size and loads per bottle. I called in to get the actual real measurement of dosing per load and am posting it here for other's benefit (especially if you want to really price compare against competitors).

Tide HE Dosing Cup Measurements:
Line 1 - 1.5 oz (3 tbsps) = "Medium load"
Line 2 - 2 oz (4 tbsps)
Line 3 - 2.25 oz (4.5 tbsps) = "Large load"
Line 4 - 2.75 oz (5.5 tbsps)
Line 5 - 4 oz (8 tbsps) = "HE Full Load"

Since most people run their HE washers with Full Loads, not 1/2 full, the 50 oz in the bottle get you 1.5 Full HE Loads, not the 32 "medium" loads promised on the front of the bottle. It is still worth buying for product performance reasons, but if you are on a strict budget and trying to compare brands, be sure to do the math on their caps too and compare apples to apples.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2016

reviews.review_text: I received two free bottles of tide laundry detergent to try and was very impressed with the product. I was asked to do a load on quick wash cycle, so I chose a blanket that my son had used while being sick the other day. The first thing I noticed was while measuring the detergent out it is hard to read the line since the detergent and cap are both blue. As for the the blanket, it came out clean and smelled very nice. Some times the blankets take a little longer because it seems they have to spin longer but not this time. The load took the exact amount of time the machine said. I did notice that there are hardly any bubbles or suds in the washer. When normally the blanket would have visible bubble and suds. I also did a load of my kids darks on normal cycle and they turned out very clean. I would buy this product. I feel it gets the laundry clean and does it in a less time.

reviews.review_title: Not the High Efficiency version - be aware
reviews.review_text:
I specifically ordered the High Efficiency (HE) version of this Tide detergent, but what I received wasn’t the HE-labeled product. That was pretty frustrating since my machine requires HE detergent, and the whole reason I chose this listing was because it advertised that version.

The product itself is still classic Tide—cleans well, smells fresh, and the cap with dosing bars is convenient once you get the hang of it. But if you’re ordering for an HE washer like I was, double-check the listing and maybe reach out to the seller before buying. I’m knocking off a couple stars just because I didn’t get what I was expecting.

reviews.review_title: Perfect Detergent for a Fresh, Deep Clean Every Time
reviews.review_text:
Tide Laundry Detergent Liquid in the Original Scent is hands down my favorite laundry detergent. The scent is fresh and classic—just the way I remember it. It’s strong enough to leave my clothes smelling amazing without being overpowering.

This detergent does an excellent job of deep cleaning, even with my toughest loads. It gets out stains, dirt, and odors effectively, which is especially important with my kids' clothes and workout gear. I’ve noticed that my whites are noticeably brighter and my colors stay vibrant, which is a huge plus for me. It really helps with keeping fabrics looking like new.

The 132 fl oz bottle is a great value because it lasts for a long time, giving me 100 loads of clean, fresh laundry. It’s also HE-compatible, so it works perfectly in my high-efficiency washer. Tide has always been a trusted brand for me, and this liquid detergent lives up to that reputation.

Overall, if you're looking for a reliable detergent that cleans well, smells great, and brightens your clothes, I highly recommend this Tide product. It’s the best detergent I’ve used and will definitely keep buying it.
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025

reviews.review_title: I used Tide for all the time
reviews.review_text: I have always used Tide to wash clothes. Just put a little in and the clothes smell good. It has great cleaning power. I have never used anything else. The clothes smell good every time after washing. One advantage of this bottle is that it will not fall out. It is really convenient and affordable. I like it very much.

reviews.review_title: Save and Subscribe Item for me!
reviews.review_text:
I never thought I'd be writing a review for laundry detergent, but here I am. Let me tell you, Tide laundry soap is like a miracle worker in a bottle. Not only does it clean my clothes better than my ex ever could, but it also leaves them smelling so fresh and clean that I sometimes catch myself sniffing my own shirt like a weirdo.

I accidentally spilled red wine all over my favorite white shirt the other day (don't ask how, it's a long story involving a cat and a water balloon), and I thought for sure it was ruined. But lo and behold, Tide swooped in like a superhero and saved the day. The stain was gone faster than my dignity at karaoke night.

So if you want your clothes to be cleaner than your conscience after lying about liking your friend's terrible cooking, give Tide laundry soap a try. Just be prepared for your clothes to look so good that people might mistake you for a model walking the runway (or at least that's what I tell myself).

reviews.review_title: Classic Clean You Can Count On!
reviews.review_text:
LEAKED TWICE DURING DELIVERY – UNRELIABLE SHIPPING
I ordered this Tide detergent through Subscribe & Save, but both bottles arrived leaking—not once, but twice. I canceled my subscription immediately since it clearly wasn’t secure enough for shipping. Thankfully, I got a full refund, but the hassle was a real disappointment. Now I plan to purchase in person locally to avoid any more delivery issues.
📌 Why this matters:
Tide is a top-rated, effective detergent—#1 for cleaning power and scent
But recurring packaging leaks during shipping make it unreliable for subscription orders.
👍 Summary: Great detergent in-person—but definitely avoid Subscribe & Save shipping unless they fix packaging issues.

reviews.review_title: Tide's HE Turbo Clean Detergent: The Superhero of Laundry
reviews.review_text:
Tide's new HE Turbo Clean detergent is like a superhero for your laundry. It's got the power to attack tough body soils and keep your whites white and colors colorful, all while leaving behind a refreshing scent. And with its Smart Suds technology, the suds clean faster and rinse out quicker, even in cold cycles.

But what really sets this detergent apart is the innovative Smart Pouch packaging. It's like a secret weapon for your laundry room. Just pour it directly into an empty Tide bottle or use it with a measuring cup and watch as it transforms your dirty clothes into sparkling clean ones.

In short, Tide's HE Turbo Clean detergent is the ultimate ally in the never-ending battle against dirty laundry. So if you want to emerge victorious, give it a try and let the cleaning commence!

reviews.review_text: Ordered 4 of these via subscribe and save a few months ago. They appeared to come directly from P&G. I have purchased Tide from Amazon previously and never had an issue. Not sure what it is but batch is not right. First off, the scent is not the normal scent even though it says Original on the bottle. The main problem is that it seems way too concentrated. I put just a tiny bit and my washing machine has tons of suds. It takes 3 or 4 extra rinses go get all the soap out. On top of this, my wife says that her skin was itching and burning, possibly from this detergent. I tried a small bottle of Persil and it worked normally with no complaints from my wife. The bottle and description do say HE (high efficiency) but my washing machine is a Maytag Neptune which is HE so it should be compatible. Not going to buy this anymore :(

reviews.review_text:
In the realm of laundry care, few products stand as iconic and reliable as Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent. As a discerning consumer who values both cleanliness and fabric care, I've come to rely on Tide for consistently outstanding results. Allow me to share my experience with this household staple.

First and foremost, Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent delivers unparalleled cleaning power. Whether tackling tough stains, odors, or everyday dirt and grime, it excels in lifting and removing impurities from fabrics of all kinds. From muddy sports uniforms to wine-stained tablecloths, Tide's advanced formula penetrates deep into the fibers, leaving clothes immaculately clean and smelling fresh with every wash.

One of the standout features of Tide is its ability to deliver exceptional results across a wide range of washing conditions. Whether you're dealing with hard water, cold water, or high-efficiency machines, Tide's formula is specially designed to perform optimally, ensuring consistent cleanliness and vibrant colors wash after wash. This versatility makes it a go-to choice for households of all kinds, from busy families to individuals with sensitive skin.

Beyond its cleansing power, Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent also prioritizes fabric care. Unlike some harsh detergents that can leave clothes feeling stiff or worn, Tide's gentle yet effective formula helps preserve the softness and integrity of fabrics over time. Whether washing delicate linens or everyday garments, you can trust Tide to maintain the quality and longevity of your clothing investment.

Another aspect worth mentioning is Tide's commitment to innovation and sustainability. With a focus on reducing environmental impact while maintaining performance, Tide continues to evolve its formulas and packaging to meet the needs of today's conscientious consumers. From concentrated formulas that require less water and packaging to initiatives aimed at reducing carbon emissions, Tide is leading the way in responsible laundry care.

In conclusion, Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent is more than just a cleaning product – it's a trusted ally in the quest for fresh, clean clothes. With its unbeatable cleaning power, fabric care benefits, and commitment to innovation and sustainability, Tide has earned its place as a household essential. Whether tackling tough stains or everyday laundry needs, Tide delivers results you can see, feel, and trust. Say goodbye to laundry woes and hello to the pristine clean of Tide.

It's compatible with high-efficiency washers, making it a convenient choice for modern laundry needs.

The 64-load size is practical for households, and the packaging is user-friendly. While it's a bit pricier than some alternatives, the performance justifies the cost. Overall, if you're looking for a dependable detergent that combines cleaning power with a pleasant scent, this Tide variant is a solid choice.

reviews.review_text:
So, I finally got my hands on a big ol' jug of Tide Original Scent liquid detergent (the HE compatible, 100-load, 132 fl oz one). Now, first things first, the packaging wasn't exactly perfect. When it arrived, the cover had burst a bit, and there was a small amount of spillage. Not a huge deal, but definitely a little annoying to clean up right off the bat.
However, once I wiped it down and got past that, it's classic Tide. You know that fresh, clean scent? It's right there. And as for cleaning, it's Tide! It really does a good job of getting clothes clean, even with tough stains. I appreciate that it's HE compatible, so it works well with my high-efficiency washer without getting super sudsy.

reviews.review_text:
Tide is, eh, Tide! Very good laundry detergent. Very convenient for refilling my old Tide dispenser.

Pricewise, at 18.5 cents an ounce, not that competitive. You can get it cheaper at the grocery store, or at your local/regional big box store is you catch a sale. That's the only reason I gave it 4 stars, rather than 5. Convenience-wise, you can't beat it. Price-wise, catch a sale and you can get for about 3 cents per ounce cheaper. If you catch a sale at the store and depending on the size, that equates to about 4-7 $ in savings per purchase.

Tide, do you hear me?

reviews.review_text: I HAVE A FEMALE YORKSHIRE TERRIER. AS AN AFTERNOON TREAT AND AFTER GROOMING I GIVE HER TREATS FROM PURINA VARIETY SNAPS. SHE LOVES ALL FLAVORS. I STARTED HER ON THE CHICKEN FLAVOR FOR THREE DAYS TO SEE HER DIGESTIVE TOLERANCE SHE ATE THEM AND LOVED THEM. NEXT I TRIED BEEF,THEN LIVER. ENDING WITH LAMB. SHE EATS ALL FLAVORS WITH THE SAME GUSTO. I ORDER TWO BOXES AT A TIME. NOW WHEN I LEAVE HER TO GO SHOP I PUT THEM HIDDEN EVERY WHERE I THINK SHE WOULD LOOK AND SHE DOES FIND THEM. A GOOD GAME FOR WHEN IM GONE. P.S. SHE WAITS BY MY DOOR REMEMBER A LONG WALK HELPS WALK OFF EXTRA TREATS.

reviews.review_title: NOT HE Product: Container lacks HE icon & label does not mention HE. Possible damage to HE washer!
reviews.review_text: The product I've been receiving for months using S&S is NOT like that pictured and is NOT the HE product. Since I had a non-HE washer, I didn't care. But, I just got an HE machine and so now I do care: Bad things happen if you use a non-HE detergent (or, in the case of my new washer, a merely HE-compatible detergent) in an HE washer. The absence of the HE icon in the received product cinches it: The product is NOT HE and so I strongly suggest it not be used in an HE washer. Amazon: Please wake up and ship the HE product having an HE icon like the picture and description! According to the Google Search summary, the result of using non-HE detergent in an HE machine is oversudsing, WHICH CAN PERMANENTLY DAMAGE A WASHER. LIABILITY ISSUES MAY ARISE!
reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2025

all_reviews.review_title: Perfect Detergent for a Fresh, Deep Clean Every Time
all_reviews.review_text:
Tide Laundry Detergent Liquid in the Original Scent is hands down my favorite laundry detergent. The scent is fresh and classic—just the way I remember it. It’s strong enough to leave my clothes smelling amazing without being overpowering.

This detergent does an excellent job of deep cleaning, even with my toughest loads. It gets out stains, dirt, and odors effectively, which is especially important with my kids' clothes and workout gear. I’ve noticed that my whites are noticeably brighter and my colors stay vibrant, which is a huge plus for me. It really helps with keeping fabrics looking like new.

The 132 fl oz bottle is a great value because it lasts for a long time, giving me 100 loads of clean, fresh laundry. It’s also HE-compatible, so it works perfectly in my high-efficiency washer. Tide has always been a trusted brand for me, and this liquid detergent lives up to that reputation.

Overall, if you're looking for a reliable detergent that cleans well, smells great, and brightens your clothes, I highly recommend this Tide product. It’s the best detergent I’ve used and will definitely keep buying it.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025

all_reviews.review_title: Reliable Clean with a Fresh Scent
all_reviews.review_text:
I've been using Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent in the Original Scent for years, and it consistently delivers excellent results. The detergent effectively removes everyday dirt and stains, leaving clothes smelling fresh without being overpowering. It's compatible with high-efficiency washers, making it a convenient choice for modern laundry needs.

The 64-load size is practical for households, and the packaging is user-friendly. While it's a bit pricier than some alternatives, the performance justifies the cost. Overall, if you're looking for a dependable detergent that combines cleaning power with a pleasant scent, this Tide variant is a solid choice.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2025

all_reviews.review_text: Securely packaged and arrived on time. Brand favorite. Has consistently worked for me. Very sensitive skin. Will break out if you look at me wrong. Tide Sensitive doesn't give me the same sense of "clean" feeling. Tide Original has never let me down. Everything comes out feeling and smelling clean and I never have a negative reaction. Works on the toughest of stains. Run the item under cold water, put Tide Original on it, & let it sit. Before washing, give a good hand scrub then in the proper wash load. Comes out clean every time. Tide Original, all day, all the way....
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2025

all_reviews.review_title: Price of Tide refills has increased almost 33% since 2019 and 12% since October 2020.
all_reviews.review_text: I started ordering these refills a few years ago. I like being able to refill my detergent bottle with less packaging and with less than some giant container that is difficult to lift or store. I'm always sensitive to the cost per ounce of liquid detergent and I compare the cost vs just buying a new bottle of detergent every time. Today I wanted to buy another refill pack only to find that the price has gone up 33% since late 2019, and 12% just since October 2020. I think I'm going to shop around a bit before I make any more purchases of these refill packs.

all_reviews.review_title: and people in my life I recommend brands to
all_reviews.review_text: Hey Tide, I'm so angry with you. You have ruined my clothing. I live in downtown Manhattan. I have a lot of friends, family, and people in my life I recommend brands to. I trusted Tide. Living in New York as a millennial who is still working hard to get up the ladder & grow my career, I have to be careful how I spend - and my clothes are something I pick with care, and take pride in. I trusted you (a brand I've known my whole life, and was always loyal to) to help me take care of my clothes. I repeat: I trusted you. And today, you ruined my clothes. Stained blue - and upon hopping on Google (in tears, calling my mom, while packing for a vacation I'd so been looking forward to) I learned that this product has ruined other people's clothes, too. And you've done nothing about it. Which is truly maddening - you're a trusted, beloved brand! Why would you continue to market a product that you are well aware ruins people's clothing? They trusted you. They saw that Tide logo and thought, "they'll take care of me & the things I choose to buy and wear every day. They'll deliver." And you've hurt a lot of people with a product that, as it turns out, isn't trustworthy. I'm disappointed, above anything. I have a load of stained, sopping wet clothes spread over my tiny apartment kitchen as I frantically try to rinse out an excess detergent, and salvage what I can. I'm heading home for the week - my best friend is getting married - and I decided to go shopping for my trip. I chose Tide this morning at the grocery store to do my laundry. I leave for the airport in two hours, and have a kitchen full of soaking, stained, brand new clothes. You have lost a lifelong customer. And many more, as I'll continue to write about this on any forum I can find until you discontinue this product. It isn't fair - we trusted you.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017

all_reviews.review_title: Tide Original Scent Liquid Laundry Detergent: Trusted Cleaning Power for Fresh, Clean Clothes
all_reviews.review_text:
Tide Original Scent Liquid Laundry Detergent has been a staple in my household for years, and it continues to impress with its exceptional cleaning power and refreshing scent.

With 64 loads packed into a 92 fl oz bottle, this detergent offers excellent value for money, making it a cost-effective option for families or individuals with much laundry to tackle. The high-efficiency (HE) formula ensures that it's suitable for use in both standard and high-efficiency washing machines, providing versatility and convenience.

What sets Tide apart is its ability to effectively remove tough stains and odors, leaving clothes looking and smelling fresh and clean after every wash. Whether it's food stains, grass marks, or sweat odors, Tide tackles them all easily, even in cold water cycles.

The Original Scent is a classic favorite, offering a pleasant, long-lasting fragrance that leaves laundry smelling great for days. It's not overpowering but provides just the right amount of freshness.

While Tide may be slightly pricier than other laundry detergents on the market, its superior cleaning performance and reliable results make it worth the investment. Plus, the large bottle size means fewer trips to the store for replenishment.

Overall, Tide Original Scent Liquid Laundry Detergent is a trusted and reliable choice for anyone seeking clean, fresh-smelling clothes with minimal effort. It's a household essential that I highly recommend to others looking for top-quality laundry care.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2024

all_reviews.review_title: New HE Turbo Clean works great!
all_reviews.review_text:
I received 2 bottles of liquid Tide HE Turbo Clean to try out for free.

As a mother of 2 small children (ages 7 and 2) plus 2 dogs, I end up doing several loads of laundry per week. We have had an HE washer for only a couple of years and in that time frame, I have used several different brands and types of detergent. One of my biggest complaints with the HE brands of detergent is that there is often a residue left on our clothing after a cycle is finished (which is especially apparent when cleaning black or dark colored clothing). The new Tide HE Turbo Clean claims to eliminate this problem, so I was eager to put it to the test.

I first was asked to do a Quick Cycle using the detergent to demonstrate how the Turbo Clean performed in a faster time. I grabbed the first available items of clothing that were ready for a wash to perform this experiment - my daughter's chlorine-soaked swim suit and cover up. I had a little bit of difficulty measuring the correct amount of detergent, as the cap with measuring lines in it is blue and so is the detergent. I usually add an oxygen booster powder to each load but since I wanted to get a true sense of how this detergent worked, I left out this step for this experiment. Once the Turbo Clean was added to the detergent dispenser, I ran the Quick Cycle. The length of time for the load to be finished coordinated exactly to the time counter on the machine. I have found with using other detergents that it takes longer than stated on the machine since there are often extra suds left over that take additional time to rinse off. The swim suit and cover up came out smelling clean and fresh with no traces of chlorine whatsoever. I was impressed, as with my usual detergent there is definitely still a slight chemical smell.

Next up was running a normal wash cycle. For this, I used my older daughter's clothing. She had just happened to have gotten a large pizza stain on her white shirt, so I was eager to see how the Tide Turbo Clean would work on this type of dirt. Again, I omitted the usual oxygen booster but did use a spray on stain remover. This time, the actual cycle end time ended up being 2 minutes quicker than what was first projected by the machine - a huge improvement. All of her clothes came out smelling clean. However, the pizza stain remained. (Honestly though, I am not sure that any detergent would have removed it without bleach.) The bottoms of her socks were clean and other small dirt stains were gone.

I then did a load of toddler clothes. Although not as dirty as her older sister's clothing, her clothes did contain surface food spots, urine dampness and grass stains. I used less of the detergent since the load of clothes was smaller. Once again, the cycle was perfectly coordinated with the timer on the machine. I think of the loads of laundry done, this one worked the best with the detergent. Everything came out looking fresh and new. She is tough on her socks and with my regular detergent, they still look dingy. With the Tide HE Turbo Clean, they came out bright and clean.

I did not have an opportunity to try the detergent on my own clothing in the timeframe for which I was asked to provide my feedback. However, based on the performance of these other loads, I am optimistic that the issue of long, over-sudded cycles will be eliminated. Apart from the measuring difficulties, the Tide is easy to use. I feel like a little goes a long way and you can't beat the fresh scent Tide can be counted on to provide. I would definitely continue to use the Turbo Clean and would recommend it to other busy laundry-doers!
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2015

all_reviews.review_text:
I was given this product for free in exchange for my honest review, and honestly..... I loved it!

I have a family of five; my husband, my 10 year old son, my 3 year old son, my 11 month old son, and myself. Boys, boys, boys... and boys=MESS!

I evaluated how this product worked in a few different ways. First, I tried this out on my husband's clothes (I wash his separately because his job and hobbies are quite dirty... furniture manufacturing and car mechanics). For his clothes, I used the regular cycle and was surprised to see that the product did, indeed, do one of the things it claimed to do. Usually, with my other brand of detergent, my washer tells me I have 1 minute left in the cycle for about 10-15 minutes. So, I was surprised to see that it actually finished the cycle ON TIME! That was nice.. His clothes not only smelled nice, but came out quite clean. I didn't tell him that I was trying anything different beforehand, just to see if he would notice, and he DID! He asked me what I did differently, because his clothes actually had that "clean smell" all day at work. He also commented that he didn't notice that "film" on his clothes either. Almost a week later, his clothes still smell nice!

Next, I washed my children's clothes. I wash my 10 year old's clothes separately from my younger two son's clothes. I decided to use the quick wash cycle with my oldest son's clothes, and it definitely got that pre-teen boy smell out! And better, I believe, than my usual brand does. From then, I decided to experiment with a white polo shirt that belongs to my 3 year old. He had spilled chocolate milk all down the front of it, and the stain had set in. I wanted to see the true power of the Tide Turbo Clean, so I bravely washed it without bleach. Did it remove the stain?? Not all the way, but I could barely see it, which surprised me, because that spill happened about 4 days prior to washing it. I washed it again, and added bleach, and poof... the stain was completely gone.

Now, I was hesitant on washing my 11 month old's clothing, seeing as I have always used a dye-free brand of detergent for his clothes (for fear of sensitive skin issues), but I tried it anyways. His clothes, like the other clothes, washed and smelled great, too. And luckily, no skin irritation as of yet (it's only been about 2 days since I washed his clothes with this).

My last experiment (in the time allotted for this review) was to wash a bed pillow that I was going to throw away because of it's filthiness. It had yellowed badly and had a sweaty, stinky odor. I ran it in my washer on a "heavily soiled" cycle, again with no bleach to test the strength of the product (and because I was just going to throw this pillow away anyways, so why not). The yellowing is very, very slight now... and the smell is COMPLETELY gone. I now don't need to throw it away. It smells so clean and fresh!

I do believe that this product has made me think about my future purchases of laundry detergent. The only con I had with the product was the packaging itself. It was hard to see the different lines on the cap for the amount of detergent to use. After studying it for a few moments, and twisting and turning the cap towards the light, I could discern the different levels for each load. But another puzzling thing was that my front load washer has a "maximum" amount of liquid detergent that you can use, and the amount the cap suggested for a large load was quite a bit more than the maximum amount my washer allows. So, I didn't use the full strength, because I didn't want take a chance of messing up my washer's functionality. But obviously from my review, that did not matter because the product exceeded my expectations.

I would definitely recommend the Tide HE Turbo Clean laundry detergent!
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2015

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Product, but Deceptive Packaging Claims
all_reviews.review_text:
Tide is one of the best laundry formulations hands down, but I continue to be frustrated with their smoke & mirrors packaging promises when it comes to load size and loads per bottle. I called in to get the actual real measurement of dosing per load and am posting it here for other's benefit (especially if you want to really price compare against competitors).

Tide HE Dosing Cup Measurements:
Line 1 - 1.5 oz (3 tbsps) = "Medium load"
Line 2 - 2 oz (4 tbsps)
Line 3 - 2.25 oz (4.5 tbsps) = "Large load"
Line 4 - 2.75 oz (5.5 tbsps)
Line 5 - 4 oz (8 tbsps) = "HE Full Load"

Since most people run their HE washers with Full Loads, not 1/2 full, the 50 oz in the bottle get you 1.5 Full HE Loads, not the 32 "medium" loads promised on the front of the bottle. It is still worth buying for product performance reasons, but if you are on a strict budget and trying to compare brands, be sure to do the math on their caps too and compare apples to apples.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2016

all_reviews.review_text: I received two free bottles of tide laundry detergent to try and was very impressed with the product. I was asked to do a load on quick wash cycle, so I chose a blanket that my son had used while being sick the other day. The first thing I noticed was while measuring the detergent out it is hard to read the line since the detergent and cap are both blue. As for the the blanket, it came out clean and smelled very nice. Some times the blankets take a little longer because it seems they have to spin longer but not this time. The load took the exact amount of time the machine said. I did notice that there are hardly any bubbles or suds in the washer. When normally the blanket would have visible bubble and suds. I also did a load of my kids darks on normal cycle and they turned out very clean. I would buy this product. I feel it gets the laundry clean and does it in a less time.

Overall, the Tide was good, not great and the lines on the measuring cap were very hard to see.

all_reviews.review_title: Not the High Efficiency version - be aware
all_reviews.review_text:

The product itself is still classic Tide—cleans well, smells fresh, and the cap with dosing bars is convenient once you get the hang of it. But if you’re ordering for an HE washer like I was, double-check the listing and maybe reach out to the seller before buying. I’m knocking off a couple stars just because I didn’t get what I was expecting.

all_reviews.review_title: Perfect Detergent for a Fresh, Deep Clean Every Time
all_reviews.review_text:
Tide Laundry Detergent Liquid in the Original Scent is hands down my favorite laundry detergent. The scent is fresh and classic—just the way I remember it. It’s strong enough to leave my clothes smelling amazing without being overpowering.

This detergent does an excellent job of deep cleaning, even with my toughest loads. It gets out stains, dirt, and odors effectively, which is especially important with my kids' clothes and workout gear. I’ve noticed that my whites are noticeably brighter and my colors stay vibrant, which is a huge plus for me. It really helps with keeping fabrics looking like new.

The 132 fl oz bottle is a great value because it lasts for a long time, giving me 100 loads of clean, fresh laundry. It’s also HE-compatible, so it works perfectly in my high-efficiency washer. Tide has always been a trusted brand for me, and this liquid detergent lives up to that reputation.

Overall, if you're looking for a reliable detergent that cleans well, smells great, and brightens your clothes, I highly recommend this Tide product. It’s the best detergent I’ve used and will definitely keep buying it.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2025

all_reviews.review_title: I used Tide for all the time
all_reviews.review_text: I have always used Tide to wash clothes. Just put a little in and the clothes smell good. It has great cleaning power. I have never used anything else. The clothes smell good every time after washing. One advantage of this bottle is that it will not fall out. It is really convenient and affordable. I like it very much.

all_reviews.review_title: Save and Subscribe Item for me!
all_reviews.review_text:
I never thought I'd be writing a review for laundry detergent, but here I am. Let me tell you, Tide laundry soap is like a miracle worker in a bottle. Not only does it clean my clothes better than my ex ever could, but it also leaves them smelling so fresh and clean that I sometimes catch myself sniffing my own shirt like a weirdo.

I accidentally spilled red wine all over my favorite white shirt the other day (don't ask how, it's a long story involving a cat and a water balloon), and I thought for sure it was ruined. But lo and behold, Tide swooped in like a superhero and saved the day. The stain was gone faster than my dignity at karaoke night.

So if you want your clothes to be cleaner than your conscience after lying about liking your friend's terrible cooking, give Tide laundry soap a try. Just be prepared for your clothes to look so good that people might mistake you for a model walking the runway (or at least that's what I tell myself).
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024

all_reviews.review_text:
In the realm of laundry care, few products stand as iconic and reliable as Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent. As a discerning consumer who values both cleanliness and fabric care, I've come to rely on Tide for consistently outstanding results. Allow me to share my experience with this household staple.

First and foremost, Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent delivers unparalleled cleaning power. Whether tackling tough stains, odors, or everyday dirt and grime, it excels in lifting and removing impurities from fabrics of all kinds. From muddy sports uniforms to wine-stained tablecloths, Tide's advanced formula penetrates deep into the fibers, leaving clothes immaculately clean and smelling fresh with every wash.

One of the standout features of Tide is its ability to deliver exceptional results across a wide range of washing conditions. Whether you're dealing with hard water, cold water, or high-efficiency machines, Tide's formula is specially designed to perform optimally, ensuring consistent cleanliness and vibrant colors wash after wash. This versatility makes it a go-to choice for households of all kinds, from busy families to individuals with sensitive skin.

Beyond its cleansing power, Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent also prioritizes fabric care. Unlike some harsh detergents that can leave clothes feeling stiff or worn, Tide's gentle yet effective formula helps preserve the softness and integrity of fabrics over time. Whether washing delicate linens or everyday garments, you can trust Tide to maintain the quality and longevity of your clothing investment.

Another aspect worth mentioning is Tide's commitment to innovation and sustainability. With a focus on reducing environmental impact while maintaining performance, Tide continues to evolve its formulas and packaging to meet the needs of today's conscientious consumers. From concentrated formulas that require less water and packaging to initiatives aimed at reducing carbon emissions, Tide is leading the way in responsible laundry care.

In conclusion, Tide Liquid Laundry Detergent is more than just a cleaning product – it's a trusted ally in the quest for fresh, clean clothes. With its unbeatable cleaning power, fabric care benefits, and commitment to innovation and sustainability, Tide has earned its place as a household essential. Whether tackling tough stains or everyday laundry needs, Tide delivers results you can see, feel, and trust. Say goodbye to laundry woes and hello to the pristine clean of Tide.

all_reviews.review_title: Exactly what you want packaged incredibly well
all_reviews.review_text:
While I don’t normally order laundry detergent online, I got this during a sale that made it worth it. Still, I had the unfortunate experience of receiving laundry detergent that I had ordered online before (from Walgreens) that arrived having opened and leaked through the box upon arrival. This wasn’t the case here. The detergent was exactly how one should expect it to arrive—packaged well and not leaking.

The detergent smells nice and may just even be stronger than Tide detergent I normally buy at Costco. I definitely recommend ordering this detergent here!
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022

all_reviews.review_title: Much easier than the huge dispenser.
all_reviews.review_text:
I like this method of packaging so much more than the dispenser. I can more easily determine how much I want in my washing machine (front loader). I don't have the dispenser dripping everywhere and I don't have a cup to throw in to the machine or wash after each use. It also allows me to easily stash the extras in my closet until needed. Plus, as I teach my young children how to do laundry, if they accidentally pour too much or spill, the maximum amount lost is 1/3 of my detergent.

I love the scent of the product and it has worked well with my kids' artistic and just plain ol' "kid" stains.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020

all_reviews.review_text: This stuff is so expensive but it's my favorite laundry detergent. Didn't wanna lug this from the supermarket so I ordered here. all_reviews.review_text:
So, I finally got my hands on a big ol' jug of Tide Original Scent liquid detergent (the HE compatible, 100-load, 132 fl oz one). Now, first things first, the packaging wasn't exactly perfect. When it arrived, the cover had burst a bit, and there was a small amount of spillage. Not a huge deal, but definitely a little annoying to clean up right off the bat.
However, once I wiped it down and got past that, it's classic Tide. You know that fresh, clean scent? It's right there. And as for cleaning, it's Tide! It really does a good job of getting clothes clean, even with tough stains. I appreciate that it's HE compatible, so it works well with my high-efficiency washer without getting super sudsy.

Tide is, eh, Tide! Very good laundry detergent. Very convenient for refilling my old Tide dispenser.

Pricewise, at 18.5 cents an ounce, not that competitive. You can get it cheaper at the grocery store, or at your local/regional big box store is you catch a sale. That's the only reason I gave it 4 stars, rather than 5. Convenience-wise, you can't beat it. Price-wise, catch a sale and you can get for about 3 cents per ounce cheaper. If you catch a sale at the store and depending on the size, that equates to about 4-7 $ in savings per purchase.

Tide, do you hear me?

all_reviews.review_text:
Bought these through Amazon Pantry and wife was right from the very beginning. When using Tide any Tide Detergent you will notice a wonderful fragrance. Unfortunately we did not get that from this Tide. We ordered 2 and recently finished the two bottles. After many uses my wife noticed there was no sent at all when removing the clothing. We went to a local big box store and purchased the exact same Tide detergent. After one use I noticed the difference! I walked to the basement and the smell of the Tide hit me as I opened the door! Something just wasn't right with the purchase of this brand of Tide on Amazon. I immediately returned to my purchase which was conveniently no longer for purchase on Amazon. Oh boy... Keep your money on this product. Now my clothing smells Tide fresh for days!

BTW- I have an HE Washer w/ Steam

all_reviews.review_title: NOT HE Product: Container lacks HE icon & label does not mention HE. Possible damage to HE washer!
all_reviews.review_text: The product I've been receiving for months using S&S is NOT like that pictured and is NOT the HE product. Since I had a non-HE washer, I didn't care. But, I just got an HE machine and so now I do care: Bad things happen if you use a non-HE detergent (or, in the case of my new washer, a merely HE-compatible detergent) in an HE washer. The absence of the HE icon in the received product cinches it: The product is NOT HE and so I strongly suggest it not be used in an HE washer. Amazon: Please wake up and ship the HE product having an HE icon like the picture and description! According to the Google Search summary, the result of using non-HE detergent in an HE machine is oversudsing, WHICH CAN PERMANENTLY DAMAGE A WASHER. LIABILITY ISSUES MAY ARISE!
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2025

all_reviews.review_title: Great product when it actually arrives
all_reviews.review_text:
I’ve ordered this product for years. I use it to refill my original Tide bottle, which makes it very easy to handle. I love this product, even though the price is increasing a little.

Lately when I order it, it does not arrive at home due to being damaged in transit (listed in my order status). It is automatically sent back to Amazon facility and it takes weeks for my refund to clear. I will not purchase again if this continues.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022

all_reviews.review_text: Only 3 stars because I received the 2 bottles I ordered and was not happy. Unlike the picture on the web site there was no indication on the bottles that the detergent was HE compatible Needless to say regular detergent can damage front loading washers. I called the Tide helpline and after providing the agent with some numbers from the bottle she verified that the contents were HE compatible. She advised that the company had some problems with the labelling of the bottles. That being said I have been using tide for about 50 years. For the price I bought 2.
all_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in Canada on June 16, 2025
